purpleculture_info: Pictophonetic: 廣 indicates the sound; 石 (mineral) conveys the meaning.

    • 廣 [ guǎng ] broad, vast, wide; building, house
heisig_chinese_memo: People make extensive efforts to mine the golden yellow stones they find in caves. &nbsp
Ru_trainchinese: kuàng: (сущ) шахта, рудник, прииск; руда, ископаемое сырье
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: A cave where people dig to search for stones of gold is a mine.
humanum_full_description_en:
From " stone " to " guang " sound, the original meaning is ore. Jin Guopu's "Jiang Fu": "Below it is a gold mine boulder and a cloud of fine silver candles."

" Mine " also refers to a deposit or mining site. Tang Dufu "Eight Lament Poems-So You Pu shoots Xiangguo Qujiang Zhanggong Jiuling": "Xiangguo was born in the Southern Dynasties, and Jinpu has no ore."

" Mine " also means hard. Qing Cao Yin's "Wushan Stone Songs": "The stone is stubborn and mines, and the blade does not stubbornly, and the heel does not rise. How can the calender be able to bear the sun?
humanum_short_description_en: From " stone " to " guang " sound, the original meaning is ore.
humanum_full_description:
從「石」，「廣」聲，本義為礦石。晉郭璞〈江賦〉：「其下則金礦丹礫，雲精燭銀。」

　　「礦」也指礦床或開礦的場所。唐杜甫〈八哀詩‧故右僕射相國曲江張公九齡〉：「相國生南紀，金璞無留礦。」

　　「礦」還表示堅硬。清曹寅〈巫山石歌〉：「嗟哉石，頑而礦，礪刃不發硎，繫舂不舉踵，砑光何堪日一番，抱山泣亦徒湩湩。」

Chinese: People make extensive efforts to mine the golden yellow stones they find in caves.  
Meaning: mine
Hanzi: 矿
Story: A cave where people dig to search for stones of gold is a mine.
Kind: traditional
從「 石 」，「 廣 」聲，本義為礦石。晉郭璞〈江賦〉：「其下則金礦丹礫，雲精燭銀。」 「 礦 」也指礦床或開礦的場所。唐杜甫〈八哀詩‧故右僕射相國曲江張公九齡〉：「相國生南紀，金璞無留礦。」 「 礦 」還表示堅硬。清曹寅〈巫山石歌〉：「嗟哉石，頑而礦，礪刃不發硎，繫舂不舉踵，砑光何堪日一番，抱山泣亦徒湩湩。」
From " stone" to " guang" sound, the original meaning is ore. Jin Guopu's "Jiang Fu": "Below it is a gold mine boulder and a cloud of fine silver candles." " Mine" also refers to a deposit or mining site. Tang Dufu "Eight Lament Poems-So You Pu shoots Xiangguo Qujiang Zhanggong Jiuling": "Xiangguo was born in the Southern Dynasties, and Jinpu has no ore." " Mine" also means hard. Qing Cao Yin's "Wushan Stone Songs": "The stone is stubborn and mines, and the blade does not stubbornly, and the heel does not rise. How can the calender be able to bear the sun?

礦字的基本解释

礦
kuàng
见“矿”。

礦字的汉语字典释义

[①]［kuàng］
［《廣韻》古猛切，上梗，見。］
“丱2”的今字。“卝1”的今字。亦作“磺1”。“矿1”的繁体字。亦作“1”。
(1)矿石。
(2)矿床。亦指开矿的场所。
(3)坚硬。
(4)石针。
(5)通“獷”。参见“礦直”。

礦字的康熙字典解释

【午集下】【石字部】　礦； 康熙笔画：20； 页码：页838第16
【集韻】同磺。【周禮·地官·卝人註】卝之言礦也。金玉未成器曰礦。【郭璞·江賦】其下則金礦丹礫。　又谷名。【水經注】倚亳川水，出北山礦谷。

礦字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
礦字的起名意思

暂无。

mine
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［kuàng］
["Guangyun" Gu cuts sharply, on the stem, see you. ]
The present character of "丱2". The present character of "卝1". Also known as "Sulfur 1". Traditional characters for "mine 1". Also known as "1".
(1) Ore.
(2) Mineral deposits. Also refers to the site of mining.
(3) Hard.
(4) Stone needles.
(5) Through "A". See "mine straight".
mine
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Afternoon Set 2] [Stone Character Department] 　mine; Kangxi strokes: 20; page number: page 838 16
【Ji Yun】Same as sulfur. 【Zhou Li·Diguan·卝人Note】The words of Zhou are mine. The gold and jade unfinished tools are called mines. 【Guo Pu·Jiang Fu】Below is the gold mine boulder.　Also the name of the valley. [Water Classic] Relying on the water of Bochuan, out of Beishan Mine Valley.
